com.arm.mbed.cloud.sdk.common

Class ConnectionOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arm.mbed.cloud.sdk.common.ConnectionOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    @Preamble(description="APIs connection options/configuration")
public class ConnectionOptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

    • Field Detail

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_HOST

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_HOST
        Environment variable for setting Pelion Cloud host.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_HTTP_LOG_LEVEL

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_HTTP_LOG_LEVEL
        Environment variable for setting the level of HTTP logs when communicating to Pelion Cloud.
        See Also:
        for more details about the possible values., Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_API_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_API_KEY
        Environment variable for setting the API Key to use for Pelion Cloud.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_FORCE_CLEAR

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_FORCE_CLEAR
        Environment variable for forcing the removal of notification channels on start.

        Warning: this can destroy existing channels so should not be used in development, but useful for production deployments where service restarts should be automated.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_SKIP_CLEANUP

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_SKIP_CLEANUP
        Environment variable for skipping any clean-up regarding notifications on exit.

        Warning: this will leave residual state for channels and subscriptions so should be used with care in development, but useful for production deployments to reduce the overhead or restart the service.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_AUTOSTART

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_AUTOSTART
        Environment variable for starting automatically notification listening daemon threads.

        Note: for systems using server initiated notification mode, this should be disabled.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionOptions

        public ConnectionOptions()
        Constructor for communications to Arm Pelion Cloud.

        Note: the API key will be read from environment variables or .env file. ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE_API_KEY is required to be set.

      • ConnectionOptions

        public ConnectionOptions(java.lang.String apiKey)
        Constructor for communications to Arm Pelion Cloud.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - API key to use. The host does not need to be specified and will default to Arm Pelion Cloud production system.

      • ConnectionOptions

        public ConnectionOptions(java.lang.String apiKey,
                         java.lang.String host)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - API key to use.
        host - Arm Pelion Cloud URL

        public static ConnectionOptions newConfiguration()
        Generates a new Pelion Cloud connection configuration.

        Note: the API key will be read from environment variables or .env file.

        This is similar to ConnectionOptions()

      • newConfiguration

        public static ConnectionOptions newConfiguration(java.lang.String apiKey,
                                                 java.lang.String host)
        Generates a new Pelion Cloud connection configuration.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - API key to use.
        host - Host address of the Cloud to use. The host does not need to be specified and will default to Arm Pelion Cloud production system.
        Returns:

      • isAutostartDaemon

        public boolean isAutostartDaemon()
        States whether daemons should autostart when needed.
        Returns:
        true if the daemon will autostart when necessary.

      • setAutostartDaemon

        public void setAutostartDaemon(@DefaultValue(value="TRUE")
                               boolean autostartDaemon)
        Sets whether daemon should autostart when needed. If set to false, an exception will be raised if a daemon is required but not started.
        Parameters:
        autostartDaemon - autostart mode for the daemon.

      • autostartDaemon

        public ConnectionOptions autostartDaemon(@DefaultValue(value="TRUE")

        Sets autostart daemon mode.

        Note: Similar to setAutostartDaemon(boolean)

        Parameters:
        autostartDaemonMode - mode to apply.
        Returns:
        these connection options.

      • autostartDaemon

        public ConnectionOptions autostartDaemon()
        Sets autostart daemon mode to true.

        Note: Similar to autostartDaemon(boolean)

        Returns:
        these connection options.

      • isForceClear

        public boolean isForceClear()
        States whether any existing notification channel should be cleared before a new one is created.
        Returns:
        True if the channel will be cleared. False otherwise.

      • setForceClear

        public void setForceClear(@DefaultValue(value="FALSE")
                          boolean forceClear)
        Sets whether any existing notification channel should be cleared before a new one is created.

        Warning: This flag should only be set to True with caution and in automated environments such as server-side applications where service restart is automated. It will indeed remove any existing notification channel.

        Parameters:
        forceClear - True if the channel should be cleared. False otherwise.

      • forceClear

        public ConnectionOptions forceClear()
        Ensures that any notification channel is cleared before one is created.

        Warning: this flag should only be used with caution in automated/production environments such as server-side applications where service restart is automated.

        Returns:
        these connection options.

      • forceClear

        public ConnectionOptions forceClear(@DefaultValue(value="FALSE")
                                    boolean forceClear)
        Sets whether any existing notification channel should be cleared before a new one is created.

        Note: Similar to setForceClear(boolean)

        Parameters:
        forceClear - True if the channel should be cleared. False otherwise.
        Returns:
        these connection options.

      • isSkipCleanup

        public boolean isSkipCleanup()
        States whether any existing notification channel and subscriptions will not be cleared on SDK exit.
        Returns:
        True if the clean-up will be skipped. False otherwise.

      • setSkipCleanup

        public void setSkipCleanup(@DefaultValue(value="FALSE")
                           boolean skipCleanup)
        Sets whether any existing notification channel and subscriptions should not be cleared on SDK exit.

        Warning: This flag should only be set to True with caution and in automated environments such as server-side applications where service restart is automated. Cleanup on exit would indeed create some overhead on restart.

        Parameters:
        skipCleanup - True if clean-up should be skipped. False otherwise.

      • skipCleanup

        public ConnectionOptions skipCleanup(@DefaultValue(value="FALSE")
                                     boolean skipCleanup)
        Sets whether any existing notification channel and subscriptions should not be cleared on SDK exit.

        Note: Similar to setSkipCleanup(boolean)

        Parameters:
        skipCleanup - True if clean-up should be skipped. False otherwise.
        Returns:
        these connection options.

      • skipCleanup

        public ConnectionOptions skipCleanup()
        Ensures that any clean-up is skipped on SDK exit.

        Warning: this flag should only be used with caution in automated/production environments such as server-side applications where service restart is automated.

        Returns:
        these connection options.
